title: Magnetic force - change length of wire in circuit

content.description: A circuit consists of a metal rod with resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"> <mi>R</mi> </math> connected to a battery by wires of negligible resistance. Part of the rod passes through a small region with a magnetic field directed out of the page, as shown. The magnitude of the magnetic force exerted on the current-carrying rod is <math alttext="F sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math>. The circuit is then changed by replacing the rod with a rod that is twice as long, while still made from the same material and with the same cross-sectional area. No changes are made to the magnetic field or the size of the region.
content.question: What is the net magnetic force exerted on the new rod?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub B, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub B, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
